title: Finding the X- and Y- Intercepts
text: $$x+2y=10$$. The x-intercept can be calculated by the equation $$x=10$$, and the y-intercept can be calculated by the equation $$2y=10$$. Solving these equations, we get the x-intercept as $$10$$ and the y-intercept as $$5$$. $$10+5=15$$
speech: x plus 2 y, is equal to 10 . The x-intercept can be calculated by the equation  x, is equal to, 10 , and the y-intercept can be calculated by the equation  2 y, is equal to 10 . Solving these equations, we get the x-intercept as  10  and the y-intercept as  5 .  10 plus 5 is equal to 15
